1.title: Run for the Roses
1.plot: We're in the home Katherine and Bryan, who left their hearts in Kentucky but now the live far away. They're looking for a way to make their baby feel as if they've never left the Bluegrass state.

2.title: Kentucky Roots
2.plot: The team continues with nursery for Kathryn and Bryan, two Kentucky natives who now live out-of-state. When you say Kentucky, reminders of horses and the Derby, old barns, and rolling hills come to mind. This nursery has it all.

3.title: All Star Baby
3.plot: For Schrita and Shante, apartment living suits our couple's busy lifestyle. With plenty of love to give, our couple brought a special needs teenager into their home. Now they welcome a baby of their own with a vintage sports themed nursery.

4.title: The Homestretch
4.plot: We're back in the home of Schrita and Shante to complete a vintage sports themed nursery. Sports plays an important role in the life of this family. Tight restrictions on painting and modifications are no match for the Baby Makes 3 design team, and we hit a home run.

5.title: Beaches, Books, and Baby
5.plot: Liz and CJ lives have been defined by vacations at the beach. They've decided to use one of the larger rooms in their home for the nursery, creating a space that mom and dad can enjoy as well. We're exploring the use of color for creating a relaxed coastal atmosphere.

6.title: Sea-side Nursery
6.plot: Liz and CJ have found peace and tranquility through vacations at the beach. We'll be completing our nursery using coastal elements with soft pastels. There's an emphasis on learning through books and toys as we finish our spacious "sea-side" nursery.

7.title: Baby Makes 4
7.plot: We're in the home of Marley and Michael, who have been surprised with twins. With nearly 140,000 multiple births in the U.S. each year, twins are more common than many think. It offers numerous challenges to first-time parents, and the Baby Makes 3 team is here to help.

8.title: Side by Side
8.plot: Marley and Michael are not just having twins, they're having a girl and a boy who will sharing the same room. Travel is important to our couple, and they hope to impart to their children a sense of wide eyed wonder about the world in which we live.

9.title: Crib for a Cub
9.plot: Kate and Alex completely renovated a 1930s mill house, down to the last 90 square feet. That's going to be baby's room, and it's not a lot of space. That's our challenge: How do you create a warm, functional nursery when space is at a premium. And, they want a safari theme.

10.title: Small Safari
10.plot: Welcome to the Jungle. We've brought our parents-to-be, Kate and Alex, to Carolina Tiger Rescue, where we hope to bring their safari-themed nursery to life. Children love animals and a themed nursery such as ours is the perfect way for them to have a real appreciation for our planet.

1.title: Everything Changes
1.plot: Part 1 of 2. In the premiere, new parents help create a royal atmosphere for their daughter. Included: new painting techniques; no-sew curtains; and a unique family décor project.

2.title: Fit for a Queen
2.plot: Part 1 of 2. A celestial-themed nursery is created for a baby girl. Included: cloud-inspired ceiling trim; a sensory wall; and a "stellar" growth chart.

3.title: Stellar Beginning
3.plot: Part 1 of 2. A celestial-themed nursery is created for a baby girl. Included: cloud-inspired ceiling trim; a sensory wall; and a "stellar" growth chart.

4.title: Grandparent Daycare
4.plot: Conclusion. The team helps grandparents-to-be convert a home office into a daytime nursery. Also: creating a time capsule for a baby.

5.title: Home Is Where the Crib Is
5.plot: Part 1 of 2. Small quarters receive a fairy-themed nursery. Included: creating a storage or play area from a crawl space beneath the steps; building a dresser in the closet; and designing a starlit ceiling.

6.title: As the Potter Wheel Turns
6.plot: Conclusion. A family keepsake is created at a pottery studio. Also: adding painted fairies to the walls; finishing the illuminated ceiling; and checking the child-safety measures.

7.title: It Takes a Community
7.plot: Part 1 of 2. An eco-friendly nursery is created. Included: building a pipe bookshelf; updating the bathroom; and building a book stack lamp.

8.title: Bookish Baby
8.plot: Conclusion. The couple works with a local bookbinder to make a journal for their baby. Also: installing eco-friendly carpet tile; and building a book-themed signpost.

9.title: Boy or Girl
9.plot: Part 1 of 2. A gender-neutral nursery is created for a couple that's waiting to learn whether they're having a boy or girl. Included: bringing the outdoors inside with a reclaimed wood wall; and refurbishing an old dresser.

10.title: Natural Wonders
10.plot: Conclusion. The Season 1 finale lays out a pattern for the accent wall; adds a Dutch door; shows how to anchor furniture to the wall for child safety; and adds a play tent.

imdb.plot outline: Baby Makes 3 is an upbeat, informative and entertaining home-improvement show. Our team not only designs dream nurseries for first-time parents - we help them navigate parenthood and come to grips with the incredible changes they're facing.
imdb.title: Baby Makes 3
plot: _Baby Makes 3_ (qv) is an upbeat, informative and entertaining home-improvement show. Our team not only designs dream nurseries for first-time parents - we help them navigate parenthood and come to grips with the incredible changes they're facing.
